She had learned to navigate his moods and to avoid certain topics that seemed to set him off, but she couldn't help but feel that there was more to Mr. Bennet than met the eye. Cô biết rằng anh ta không phải là một người dễ bị tổn thương, nhưng cũng không phải là một người cứng rắn đến mức không thể cảm nhận được cảm xúc của người khác. Anh ta là một người phức tạp, đầy màu sắc, và cô cảm thấy mình đã may mắn khi được biết anh ta.

en_first_half: “Pride,” observed Mary, who piqued herself upon the solidity of her reflections, “is a very common failing, I believe. By all that I have ever read, I am convinced that it is very common indeed; that human nature is particularly prone to it, and that there are very few of us who do not
en_second_half: cherish a feeling of self-complacency on the score of some quality or other, real or imaginary. Vanity and pride are different things, though the words are often used synonymously. A person may be proud without being vain. Pride relates more to our opinion of ourselves; vanity to what we would have others think of us.”
en_results: fall prey to its insidious influence at some point in our lives. I have seen it in my own family, in the way my brother's accomplishments are always magnified in his own mind, and in the way my mother's expectations of him are constantly exceeded. I have seen it in the way my friends speak of their own abilities, as if
en_results_raw: fall prey to its insidious influence at some point in our lives. I have seen it in my own family, in the way my brother's accomplishments are always magnified in his own mind, and in the way my mother's expectations of him are constantly exceeded. I have seen it in the way my friends speak of their own abilities, as if they are the only ones who truly understand the world. And I have seen it in the way strangers boast of their wealth and status, as if it is the only measure of their worth. It is a curious thing, this pride, and one that I believe can be both a blessing and a curse. On the one hand, it can drive us to achieve great things, to push ourselves beyond what we thought was possible. On the other hand, it can lead us down a path of self-deception, causing us to see ourselves as more capable than we truly are. I am not immune to it, of course. I have my own pride, my own tendency to see myself as superior to others. But I try to be aware of it, to recognize when it is creeping in and to temper it with humility. It is a delicate balance, one that requires constant vigilance, but one that is essential if we are to truly know ourselves and the world around us.

Me enteré de que mi tío, que vive en París, había descubierto un antiguo manuscrito en el fondo de una biblioteca secreta. Según él, el manuscrito contenía una historia sobre una familia real que había desaparecido hace siglos, y él estaba convencido de que era la clave para resolver un misterio que había estado sin resolver durante generaciones. Me pidió que viajara a París para ayudarlo a investigar más a fondo, y así es como me encontré aquí, en este pequeño café, esperando a que mi tío me reciba en su apartamento. Me siento un poco nervioso, pero también emocionado por la posibilidad de descubrir algo nuevo y emocionante. Mientras espero, me he estado preguntando qué podría haber sucedido con esa familia real, y qué secreto podría estar escondido en ese manuscrito. ¿Será que mi tío ha encontrado algo importante, algo que podría cambiar la historia? Pero ¿y si es todo mentira? ¿Y si es solo una máscara que él lleva para ocultar su verdadera naturaleza? Eres mi eternidad, Jane, mi eternidad en este mundo cruel y frágil––. Y aunque no estemos juntos, aunque no podamos estar juntos, siempre estaré contigo en mi corazón, siempre te amaré––. No puedo pedirte que me perdones, no puedo pedirte que me comprendas, pero te pido que me recuerdes, que me recuerdes siempre––. Eres la luz que iluminó mi vida, la estrella que guió mi camino, la razón por la que valió la pena seguir adelante––. Y aunque esté lejos de ti, aunque esté en un lugar desconocido, siempre te llevaré contigo, siempre te llevaré en mi corazón––. No puedo dejar de amarte, no puedo dejar de quererte, no puedo dejar de recordarte––. Eres mi todo, Jane, mi todo––.

Por eso, cuando alguien dice que está "locamente enamorado", no sé qué pensar, porque no tengo suficiente información para entender el contexto o la intensidad de sus sentimientos. en_first_half: “You are too sensible a girl, Lizzy, to fall in love merely because you are warned against it; and, therefore, I am not afraid of speaking openly. Seriously, I would have you be on your guard. Do not involve yourself, or endeavour to involve him, in an affection which the want of fortune would make so very imprudent. I have nothing to say against him: he
en_second_half: is a most interesting young man; and if he had the fortune he ought to have, I should think you could not do better. But as it is—you must not let your fancy run away with you. You have sense, and we all expect you to use it. Your father would depend on your resolution and good conduct, I am sure. You must not disappoint your father.”

es_second_half: que hizo? Pues no bailó más que cuatro piezas, a pesar de escasear los caballeros, y más de una dama se quedó sentada por falta de pareja. Señor Darcy, no puede negarlo.

es_results_raw: que era lo que más me llamó la atención de ella, fue su belleza, su sonrisa radiante y su forma de bailar con una gracia que parecía casi sobrenatural. Me sentí atraído por ella de inmediato, pero no me atreví a acercarme, temiendo que me rechazara. Sin embargo, mi curiosidad se apoderó de mí y comencé a observarla desde lejos, intentando descubrir qué era lo que la hacía tan especial. Pasaron horas, y el baile llegó a su fin, pero yo no pude apartar mis ojos de ella. Fue entonces cuando la vi hablar con un hombre, un hombre que parecía ser su pareja, y mi corazón se encogió de dolor al verla sonreírle de esa manera. Me sentí traicionado, como si hubiera sido un idiota por pensar que podría tener alguna posibilidad con ella. Pero, ¿qué sabía yo de ella? ¿Qué sabía yo de su vida, de sus secretos, de sus deseos? Nada, absolutamente nada. Y fue entonces cuando me di cuenta de que mi fascinación por ella no era solo física, sino también emocional. Me sentía atraído por su misterio, por su enigmática presencia, por la sensación de que había algo más detrás de su sonrisa, algo que solo ella sabía. Y fue en ese momento que decidí que debía conocerla, que debía descubrir qué era lo que la hacía tan especial, qué era lo que la hacía tan irresistible. Pero, ¿cómo podría acercarme a ella? ¿Cómo podría hacer que me notara, que me viera, que me escuchara? La duda me atormentó durante días, pero finalmente, encontré la valentía para acercarme a ella, para hablarle, para conocerla. Y fue entonces cuando todo cambió, cuando todo se volvió más complicado de lo que nunca imaginé.

en_second_half: her own children, was so highly reprehensible. She had often wished that her father might be more mindful of the sacred vows he had made to her mother, and that he might strive to live up to the ideals of a devoted and faithful husband, but she had never dared to express her feelings to him, fearing that he would only laugh at her concerns and dismiss them as the sentimental ramblings of a romantic daughter. As she grew older, however, Elizabeth began to realize that her father's behavior was not only a personal failing, but also a reflection of the societal norms and expectations that governed the lives of women in their class. She saw how her mother, once a beautiful and vibrant young woman, had been reduced to a mere ornament, a trophy to be displayed and admired, but never truly valued or respected. And she knew that she did not want to suffer the same fate, that she wanted to be more than just a pretty face, more than just a wife and mother, but a woman with her own thoughts, her own desires, and her own ambitions. But how could she achieve this, when the world around her seemed determined to keep her in her place, to restrict her freedom and limit her choices? Elizabeth's thoughts were a jumble of emotions and doubts, but one thing was certain: she would not be silenced, she would not be ignored, and she would not be defeated.

Bu evlerin her biri, sizin ve ailenizin ihtiyaçlarını karşılayacak şekilde tasarlanmıştır ve sizin için en uygun olanını bulmak için elimizden gelen her şeyi yapacağız.

She knew that Mr. Bingley was not fond of large parties, and that Mr. Darcy was not in the habit of staying late at any entertainment, so she thought it would be more convenient for them to dine at the parsonage, and then return to Netherfield in the evening, when they could have a quiet game of whist or backgammon, and perhaps a little music, without being disturbed by the noise of a large assembly. Besides, she was anxious to have a little conversation with her daughter, who had been so long absent from home, and she hoped that by keeping them to dinner, she might be able to learn something of her plans and prospects, and perhaps even persuade her to stay a few days longer at home, which would be a great comfort to her mother, who was always anxious to have her near her.
